question: 和食
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Japanese style</kanji> <kanji>eat</kanji> ... well, let's change "eat" to "food" and you have <vocabulary>Japanese style food</vocabulary>. This is a good way to differentiate between an American style restaurant and a Japanese style restaurant. What kind of food you feeling like tonight? Oh, how about some <ja>和食</ja>?
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
